results.title: Tomorrow's today
results.creator_credit: Park Film Studios and Henry Lewes
results.brief_description: A film record of children’s paintings, showing the manner in which the environment effects the choice of subject and the style of work itself. The paintings come from school children in the East End of London and provide a grim picture of the daily scene that confronts them.

results.title: Tomorrow's quake
results.creator_credit: American Educational Films and Lewis C. Hall
results.brief_description: This film explores efforts to develop hypotheses on earthquake prediction. Explains continental drift, dilatency, plate techtonics, earthquake mechanics, seismographs, P and S waves, Seismic velocity changes, tilimeters, ground elevation, water wells and unusual animal behaviour.

results.title: Tomorrow's end. Episodes 7-12
results.brief_description: The final six half-hour episodes of “Tomorrow’s End” continue the story of brother and sister, Petey and Janey Kelly, and their futuristic adventures with the Girl from Tomorrow, Alana, to foil the evil Silverthorn and his plans to use Alana’s time capsule to alter history and destroy the world with nuclear weapons. In the end, the young trio triumph. Alana returns to her world and the Kellys to theirs, but they will never forget their travels together through time.

results.title: Tomorrow's end. Episodes 1-6
results.brief_description: At the end of the first series of “The Girl from Tomorrow”, Jenny has been badly injured and needs to travel with Alana to her home in the year 3000 to recover. Alana is a 13 year old girl who travelled back in her time capsule to Sydney 1990 where she met Jenny and her brother, Petey. This series, “Tomorrow’s End” continues the adventures of Alana, Peter and Jenny. This time they travel forward in time to join Alana’s family, but the evil Silverthorn travels with them and tricks them so he can trap them in his world of 2500.

results.title: Tomorrow's children
results.brief_description: Scenes of healthy people of many nations are juxtaposed with malnourished and crowded children of other countries to open this film which discusses the way in which population growth has interfered with the ecological balance. Discusses family planning programs as one way of alleviating the problem.

results.title: Tomorrow's child
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: With step by step precision and sympathetic understanding this film shows the fascinating story behind the latest amazing advances in ‘test-tube baby’ or more accurately, In Vitro Fertilisation techniques, with human embryo transfer by the Monash University Medical Team at the Queen Victoria Medical Centre.

results.title: Tommy's world
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission and Margot Lethlean
results.brief_description: Made with the help of Myra Hilsendorf and Victoria’s Art Project, this film utilizes the art of mentally retarded people to provide an indication of their potential capabilities. Introduces the view to Tommy’s world through his drawings and also shows the paintings of other handicapped people. The vitality, immediacy and emotional impact of their work challenges the viewer to examine conventional attitudes towards handicapped people. No dialogue, musical background only.

results.title: Tomi Ungerer: storyteller
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: An interview with Tomi Ungerer, a delightful man and gifted visual storyteller. Includes animated sequences based on three of his published illustrated books: “Moon man”, “The Three robbers” and “The Beast of M. Racine”.
